item.title: [C#]Maths Game
item.dc:creator: @David David
item.description:
@David wrote:

Well, I’ve made 2 C# programs from reading absolutely nothing about C#, I’m a C++ programmer, so it was quite similar. Meh =\

[code]using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.Text;

namespace Second_Maths_
{
class Program
{
static void Main(string[] args)
{
int a, b, c, guess, score;
score = 0;

        Random roller = new Random();

        Console.WriteLine("'Sup? Welcome to an idiots game. Good luck. You're gonna need it");
        Console.WriteLine("Press enter to start");
        Console.ReadLine();

        a = (int)(roller.NextDouble() * 10) + 1;
        b = (int)(roller.NextDouble() * 10) + 1;

        c = a + b;

        Console.WriteLine("What is {0} + {1}? ", a, b);
        guess = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        if (guess == c)
        {
            score++;
        }

        while (guess != c)
        {
            if (guess != c)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("WRONG! TRY AGAIN NOOB!");
                guess = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            }
        }

        Console.WriteLine("What is {0} - {1}? ", c, a);
        guess = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        if (guess == b)
        {
            score++;
        }

        while (guess != b)
        {
            if (guess != b)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("WRONG! TRY AGAIN NOOB!");
                guess = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            }
        }

        a = (int)(roller.NextDouble() * 10 + 1);
        b = (int)(roller.NextDouble() * 10 + 1);

        c = a * b;

        Console.WriteLine("What is {0} * {1}? ", a, b);
        guess = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        if (guess == c)
        {
            score++;
        }

        while (guess != c)
        {
            if (guess != c)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("WRONG! TRY AGAIN NOOB!");
                guess = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            }
        }

        Console.WriteLine("What is {0} / {1}? ", c, a);
        guess = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());

        if (guess == b)
        {
            score++;
        }

        while (guess != b)
        {
            if (guess != b)
            {
                Console.WriteLine("WRONG! TRY AGAIN NOOB!");
                guess = Convert.ToInt32(Console.ReadLine());
            }
        }

        Console.WriteLine("You scored {0} out of 4! ", score);
        Console.WriteLine("Press Enter for Analysis/Rating");
        Console.ReadLine();

        switch (score)
        {
            case 4:
                Console.WriteLine("Well done... you got them all right... ");
                break;
            case 3:
                Console.WriteLine("AHAHAHAH! You got one wrong!! ");
                break;
            case 2:
                Console.WriteLine("AHAHAHA! 2 WRONG YOU NUB! ");
                break;
            case 1:
                Console.WriteLine("As you can see, I'm not laughing, maybe you should get your eyes tested..? ");
                break;
            case 0:
                Console.WriteLine("Maybe you're good at P.E.?");
                break;
        }

        Console.ReadLine();
        Console.WriteLine("Press enter to exit");
        Console.ReadLine();


    }
}

}

[/code]

A cool thing is the questions are random =)
